Choe Thae Bok Meets Chinese Party Delegation
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Party Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Chinese Party Delegation 
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly conversation with the delegation of the Dandong City, Liaoning Province, Committee of the Communist Party of China headed by Secretary Zhu Shaoye on August 25.
 The head of the delegation said that China and Korea are neighbors linked with each other with mountains and rivers in between. The Sino-DPRK friendship was provided by Chairman Mao Zedong and President Kim Il Sung and the revolutionaries of the elder generation, he noted.    
 Under the wise guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il the party, the army and the people of the DPRK are registering successes in building Korean-style socialism by fully displaying the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and fortitude, he said, expressing belief that the Korean people, rallied close around Kim Jong Il, will achieve greater successes in socialist construction.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Party Delegation 
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Dandong City, Liaoning Province, Committee of the Communist Party of China.
 The gift was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by head of the delegation Zhu Shaoye, secretary of the Dandong City Committee, on August 25.

Building of Independent World Called for
Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Building of Independent World Called for
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Friday in a signed article says that the joint slogans of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea clarify the appearance of the new world that should be built in the 21st century and the target, orientation and ways of struggle of the world progressive people.
 What the humankind should build in the new century is an independent, new world, the article says, and goes on:
 The independent world means a world where the intrinsic demand of humankind is completely met and desire of each country and nation for independence and peace is realized.    
 Independence is the basic of social attributes of a human being, the intrinsic character of humankind. It is the original nature of a human being and a characteristic common to humankind to reject the exploitation and oppression, domination and subjugation and interference and pressure by others and strive to emerge and develop as a master of his own destiny, the times and the world.
 The independent world represents the world where such independence serves as a starting point of establishing all the international relations and all the members of the world community steadily consolidate and develop their relations on this basis. Each country and nation can fully exercise its sovereignty in the independent world.    
 One should never allow the old world structure of the 20th century full of contradictions to remain in the 21st century, especially the unipolar world structure dominated by the U.S. imperialists to be established. Tolerance of such structures will mean retrogression in building an independent new world and, furthermore, abandonment of the efforts to do so. 
 Close unity of peoples of all the countries advocating independence is the best way and a fundamental guarantee for building an independent, new world. It is an important way of building this world to defend and advance the socialist cause while protecting peace and security from the imperialists' moves for aggression and war.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Zambian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Zambian vice-president on a visit to the DPRK.
 It was conveyed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Vice-President Lupando Mwape on Friday.

articles.title: Performance of "Arirang" Goes On
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Zambian Delegation
    Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly conversation with the government delegation of Zambia led by Vice-President Lupando Mwape at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.
 On hand were Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Yong Suk, vice-minister of Agriculture, and others. 
 The vice-president said that President Kim Il Sung performed great feats by strengthening and developing the non-aligned movement and they would be immortal.    
 The Korean people are striving to achieve national reunification and the reunification of Korea should be achieved from an independent stand, he stressed.
